Adding a ppa in Ubuntu

24 Dec 2011

PPAs (Personal Package Archive) provide additional resources. They are small repositories you can add to get some special content.

You can add them with Bash: [bash]sudo add-apt-repository ppa:[/bash]

Lets make an example:

If you want to install Clipgrab, you add the repository first: [bash]sudo add-apt-repository ppa:clipgrab[/bash]

Then you have to update your sources: [bash]sudo apt-get update[/bash]

Now you can install clipgrab the usual way: [bash]sudo apt-get install clipgrab[/bash]

Further Reading

  • Repositories and the CommandLine
  • Clipgrab (German)
